title: Runtime crash in libgreen

labels.name: A-runtime
labels.description: Area: std's runtime and "pre-main" init for handling backtraces, unwinds, stack overflows

labels.name: I-crash
labels.description: Issue: The compiler crashes (SIGSEGV, SIGABRT, etc). Use I-ICE instead when the compiler panics.

body:
If you compile this program with `--opt-level=3 -Zlto` it will occasionally crash:

``` rust
use std::task;       
fn main() { for _ in range(0, 10000000) { task::deschedule(); } }
```

where thread #1 aborted. I have no idea what's going on here. Somehow the local task is not available when a scheduler wakes up?
